DataElement.preferredName: Esophageal Adenocarcinoma AJCC Edition 8 Pathologic Group Stage
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Pathologic stage group based on the combination of T, N, and M categories and relevant prognostic factors for esophageal adenocarcinoma, using AJCC Ed. 8 criteria.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A malignant tumor with glandular differentiation arising predominantly from Barrett mucosa in the lower third of the esophagus.  Rare examples of esophageal adenocarcinoma deriving from ectopic gastric mucosa in the upper esophagus have also been reported.  Grossly, esophageal adenocarcinomas are similar to esophageal squamous cell carcinomas.  Microscopically, adenocarcinomas arising in the setting of Barrett esophagus are typically papillary and/or tubular.  The prognosis is poor._Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology._An assessment based on the combined evaluation of the patient's T stage, M stage, and N stage, as well as prognostic parameters for specific cancers.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A malignant tumor with glandular differentiation arising predominantly from Barrett mucosa in the lower third of the esophagus.  Rare examples of esophageal adenocarcinoma deriving from ectopic gastric mucosa in the upper esophagus have also been reported.  Grossly, esophageal adenocarcinomas are similar to esophageal squamous cell carcinomas.  Microscopically, adenocarcinomas arising in the setting of Barrett esophagus are typically papillary and/or tubular.  The prognosis is poor.

Concepts.definition: A malignant tumor with glandular differentiation arising predominantly from Barrett mucosa in the lower third of the esophagus.  Rare examples of esophageal adenocarcinoma deriving from ectopic gastric mucosa in the upper esophagus have also been reported.  Grossly, esophageal adenocarcinomas are similar to esophageal squamous cell carcinomas.  Microscopically, adenocarcinomas arising in the setting of Barrett esophagus are typically papillary and/or tubular.  The prognosis is poor.

Property.preferredDefinition: Pathologic; caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.:Stage Grouping; an assessment based on the combined evaluation of the patient's T stage, M stage, and N stage. (caDSR)

Concepts.definition: Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.
An assessment based on the combined evaluation of the patient's T stage, M stage, and N stage, as well as prognostic parameters for specific cancers.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.origin: AJCC Based:Staging Criteria Based on American Joint Committee on Cancer System
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 10-4-18 Changed from Draft New to Released/tmt. 9-24-18 tt created for standardization.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Esophageal Adenocarcinoma American Joint Committee on Cancer Edition 8 Pathologic Group Stage
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A term that refers to the pathologic staging of esophageal adenocarcinoma according to the American Joint Committee on Cancer, 8th edition._An assessment based on the combined evaluation of the patient's T stage, M stage, and N stage, as well as prognostic parameters for specific cancers._The extent of a cancer in the body. Staging is usually based on the size of the tumor, whether lymph nodes contain cancer, and whether the cancer has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Pathologic Stage IB Esophageal Adenocarcinoma AJCC v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Pathologic Stage IB Esophageal Adenocarcinoma AJCC v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage IB includes: (T1a, N0, M0, G2); (T1b, N0, M0, G1-2); (T1b, N0, M0, GX). T1a: Tumor invades the lamina propria or muscularis mucosae. T1b: Tumor invades the submucosa. N0: No regional lymph node metastasis. M0: No distant metastasis. G1: Well-differentiated. GX: Grade cannot be assessed. G2: Moderately differentiated. (AJCC 8th ed.)

Concepts.longName: Pathologic Stage IB Esophageal Adenocarcinoma AJCC v8
Concepts.definition: Stage IB includes: (T1a, N0, M0, G2); (T1b, N0, M0, G1-2); (T1b, N0, M0, GX). T1a: Tumor invades the lamina propria or muscularis mucosae. T1b: Tumor invades the submucosa. N0: No regional lymph node metastasis. M0: No distant metastasis. G1: Well-differentiated. GX: Grade cannot be assessed. G2: Moderately differentiated. (AJCC 8th ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Pathologic Stage IA Esophageal Adenocarcinoma AJCC v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Pathologic Stage IA Esophageal Adenocarcinoma AJCC v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage IA includes: (T1a, N0, M0, G1); (T1a, N0, M0, GX). T1a: Tumor invades the lamina propria or muscularis mucosae. N0: No regional lymph node metastasis. M0: No distant metastasis. G1: Well-differentiated. GX: Grade cannot be assessed. (AJCC 8th ed.)

Concepts.longName: Pathologic Stage IA Esophageal Adenocarcinoma AJCC v8
Concepts.definition: Stage IA includes: (T1a, N0, M0, G1); (T1a, N0, M0, GX). T1a: Tumor invades the lamina propria or muscularis mucosae. N0: No regional lymph node metastasis. M0: No distant metastasis. G1: Well-differentiated. GX: Grade cannot be assessed. (AJCC 8th ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Pathologic Stage 0 Esophageal Adenocarcinoma AJCC v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Pathologic Stage 0 Esophageal Adenocarcinoma AJCC v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage 0 includes: Tis, N0, M0, GN/A. Tis: High-grade dysplasia, defined as malignant cells confined to the epithelium by the basement membrane. N0: No regional lymph node metastasis. M0: No distant metastasis. GN/A: Grade non-applicable. (AJCC 8th ed.)

Concepts.longName: Pathologic Stage 0 Esophageal Adenocarcinoma AJCC v8
Concepts.definition: Stage 0 includes: Tis, N0, M0, GN/A. Tis: High-grade dysplasia, defined as malignant cells confined to the epithelium by the basement membrane. N0: No regional lymph node metastasis. M0: No distant metastasis. GN/A: Grade non-applicable. (AJCC 8th ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Pathologic Stage IVB Esophageal Adenocarcinoma AJCC v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Pathologic Stage IVB Esophageal Adenocarcinoma AJCC v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage IVB includes: Any T, Any N, M1, Any G. M1: Distant metastasis. (AJCC 8th ed.)

Concepts.longName: Pathologic Stage IVB Esophageal Adenocarcinoma AJCC v8
Concepts.definition: Stage IVB includes: Any T, Any N, M1, Any G. M1: Distant metastasis. (AJCC 8th ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Pathologic Stage IVA Esophageal Adenocarcinoma AJCC v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Pathologic Stage IVA Esophageal Adenocarcinoma AJCC v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage IVA includes: (T4a, N2, M0, Any G); (T4b, N0-2, M0, Any G); (Any T, N3, M0, Any G). T4a: Tumor invades the pleura, pericardium, azygos vein, diaphragm, or peritoneum. T4b: Tumor invades other adjacent structures, such as the aorta, vertebral body, or airway. N0: No regional lymph node metastasis. N1: Tumor with metastasis in one or two regional lymph nodes. N2: Tumor with metastasis in three to six regional lymph nodes. N3: Tumor with metastasis in seven or more regional lymph nodes. M0: No distant metastasis. (AJCC 8th ed.)

Concepts.longName: Pathologic Stage IVA Esophageal Adenocarcinoma AJCC v8
Concepts.definition: Stage IVA includes: (T4a, N2, M0, Any G); (T4b, N0-2, M0, Any G); (Any T, N3, M0, Any G). T4a: Tumor invades the pleura, pericardium, azygos vein, diaphragm, or peritoneum. T4b: Tumor invades other adjacent structures, such as the aorta, vertebral body, or airway. N0: No regional lymph node metastasis. N1: Tumor with metastasis in one or two regional lymph nodes. N2: Tumor with metastasis in three to six regional lymph nodes. N3: Tumor with metastasis in seven or more regional lymph nodes. M0: No distant metastasis. (AJCC 8th ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Pathologic Stage IIIB Esophageal Adenocarcinoma AJCC v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Pathologic Stage IIIB Esophageal Adenocarcinoma AJCC v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage IIIB includes: (T2, N2, M0, Any G); (T3, N1-2, M0, Any G); (T4a, N0-1, M0, Any G). T2: Tumor invades the muscularis propria. T3: Tumor invades adventitia. T4a: Tumor invades the pleura, pericardium, azygos vein, diaphragm, or peritoneum. N0: No regional lymph node metastasis. N1: Tumor with metastasis in one or two regional lymph nodes. N2: Tumor with metastasis in three to six regional lymph nodes. M0: No distant metastasis. (AJCC 8th ed.)

Concepts.longName: Pathologic Stage IIIB Esophageal Adenocarcinoma AJCC v8
Concepts.definition: Stage IIIB includes: (T2, N2, M0, Any G); (T3, N1-2, M0, Any G); (T4a, N0-1, M0, Any G). T2: Tumor invades the muscularis propria. T3: Tumor invades adventitia. T4a: Tumor invades the pleura, pericardium, azygos vein, diaphragm, or peritoneum. N0: No regional lymph node metastasis. N1: Tumor with metastasis in one or two regional lymph nodes. N2: Tumor with metastasis in three to six regional lymph nodes. M0: No distant metastasis. (AJCC 8th ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Pathologic Stage IIIA Esophageal Adenocarcinoma AJCC v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Pathologic Stage IIIA Esophageal Adenocarcinoma AJCC v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage IIIA includes: (T1, N2, M0, Any G); (T2, N1, M0, Any G). T1: Tumor invades the lamina propria, muscularis mucosae, or submucosa. T2: Tumor invades the muscularis propria. N1: Tumor with metastasis in one or two regional lymph nodes. N2: Tumor with metastasis in three to six regional lymph nodes. M0: No distant metastasis. (AJCC 8th ed.)

Concepts.longName: Pathologic Stage IIIA Esophageal Adenocarcinoma AJCC v8
Concepts.definition: Stage IIIA includes: (T1, N2, M0, Any G); (T2, N1, M0, Any G). T1: Tumor invades the lamina propria, muscularis mucosae, or submucosa. T2: Tumor invades the muscularis propria. N1: Tumor with metastasis in one or two regional lymph nodes. N2: Tumor with metastasis in three to six regional lymph nodes. M0: No distant metastasis. (AJCC 8th ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Pathologic Stage IIB Esophageal Adenocarcinoma AJCC v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Pathologic Stage IIB Esophageal Adenocarcinoma AJCC v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage IIB includes: (T1, N1, M0, Any G); (T3, N0, M0, Any G). T1: Tumor invades the lamina propria, muscularis mucosae, or submucosa. T3: Tumor invades adventitia. N0: No regional lymph node metastasis. N1: Tumor with metastasis in one or two regional lymph nodes. M0: No distant metastasis. (AJCC 8th ed.)

Concepts.longName: Pathologic Stage IIB Esophageal Adenocarcinoma AJCC v8
Concepts.definition: Stage IIB includes: (T1, N1, M0, Any G); (T3, N0, M0, Any G). T1: Tumor invades the lamina propria, muscularis mucosae, or submucosa. T3: Tumor invades adventitia. N0: No regional lymph node metastasis. N1: Tumor with metastasis in one or two regional lymph nodes. M0: No distant metastasis. (AJCC 8th ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Pathologic Stage IIA Esophageal Adenocarcinoma AJCC v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Pathologic Stage IIA Esophageal Adenocarcinoma AJCC v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage IIA includes: (T2, N0, M0, G3); (T2, N0, M0, GX). T2: Tumor invades the muscularis propria. N0: No regional lymph node metastasis. M0: No distant metastasis. GX: Grade cannot be assessed. G3: Poorly differentiated, undifferentiated. (AJCC 8th ed.)

Concepts.longName: Pathologic Stage IIA Esophageal Adenocarcinoma AJCC v8
Concepts.definition: Stage IIA includes: (T2, N0, M0, G3); (T2, N0, M0, GX). T2: Tumor invades the muscularis propria. N0: No regional lymph node metastasis. M0: No distant metastasis. GX: Grade cannot be assessed. G3: Poorly differentiated, undifferentiated. (AJCC 8th ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Pathologic Stage IC Esophageal Adenocarcinoma AJCC v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Pathologic Stage IC Esophageal Adenocarcinoma AJCC v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage IC includes: (T1, N0, M0, G3); (T2, N0, M0, G1-2). T1: Tumor invades the lamina propria, muscularis mucosae, or submucosa. T2: Tumor invades the muscularis propria. N0: No regional lymph node metastasis. M0: No distant metastasis. G1: Well-differentiated. G2: Moderately differentiated. G3: Poorly differentiated, undifferentiated. (AJCC 8th ed.)

Concepts.longName: Pathologic Stage IC Esophageal Adenocarcinoma AJCC v8
Concepts.definition: Stage IC includes: (T1, N0, M0, G3); (T2, N0, M0, G1-2). T1: Tumor invades the lamina propria, muscularis mucosae, or submucosa. T2: Tumor invades the muscularis propria. N0: No regional lymph node metastasis. M0: No distant metastasis. G1: Well-differentiated. G2: Moderately differentiated. G3: Poorly differentiated, undifferentiated. (AJCC 8th ed.)
